citation.article-title: Pigmentiphaga kullae gen. nov., sp. nov., a novel member of the family Alcaligenaceae with the ability to decolorize azo dyes aerobically.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Pigmentiphaga kullae sp. nov.

Pigmentiphaga kullae (kul'lae. N.L. gen. n. kullae of Kulla, in honour of Hans G. Kulla, who initiated the work on the aerobic degradation of azo dyes by bacteria that resulted in the isolation of strain K24T)
Gram-negative, motile, rod-shaped, non-sporeforming bacterium (1.3-4 lm in length and 0.7-1.2 lm in diameter).
Colonies are opaque, circular and convex with an entire margin.
The strain grows at 30, 37 and 42 °C; no growth at 4 °C.
The strain is oxidase- and catalase-positive.

The following compounds are not hydrolysed: p-nitrophenyl β-D-galactopyranoside, p-nitrophenyl β-D-glucuronide, p-nitrophenyl α-D-glucopyranoside, p-nitrophenyl β-D-glucopyranoside, p-nitrophenyl βD- xylopyranoside, bis-p-nitrophenyl phosphate, bis-pnitrophenyl phenylphosphonate, bis-p-nitrophenyl phosphorylcholine, L-aniline p-nitroanilide, γ-L-glutamate p-nitroanilide and L-proline p-nitroanilide.

The following compounds are used as sole sources of carbon: acetate, propionate, cis-aconitate, trans-aconitate, adipate, azelate, citrate, fumarate, glutarate, L-3-hydroxybutyrate, itaconate, DL-lactate, mesaconate, 2-oxoglutarate, pyruvate, suberate, L-aspartate, 3-hydroxybenzoate and 4-hydroxybenzoate.

The following compounds are not assimilated: N-acetylgalactosamine, N-acetylglucosamine, L-arabinose, L-arbutin, D-cellobiose, D-fructose, D-galactose, gluconate, D-glucose, D-maltose, D-mannose, α-D-melibiose, L-rhamnose, D-ribose, D-sucrose, salicin, D-trehalose, D-xylose, adonitol, i-inositol, maltitol, D-mannitol, D-sorbitol, putrescine, 4-aminobutyrate, L-alanine, L-histidine, L-leucine, L-ornithine, L-phenylalanine, L-serine, L-tryptophan and phenylacetate.

No acids are produced from glucose, lactose, sucrose, D-mannitol, dulcitol, salicin, adonitol, inositol, sorbitol, L-arabinose, raffinose, rhamnose, maltose, D-xylose, trehalose, cellobiose, methyl D-glucoside, erythritol, melibiose, D-arabitol or D-mannose.
The G+­C content of the DNA is 68.5±0.3 mol%.
The major isoprenoid quinone is ubiquinon Q-8.
The main components in the polyamine pattern are putrescine and 2-hydroxyputrescine.
The major fatty acids are 16:0, summed feature 3 (16:1 ISO I and 14:0 3-OH), summed feature 7 (18:1ω7c, 18:1ω9ct and/or 18:1ω12t), 10:0 3-OH, 14:0 2-OH, 16:0 2-OH, 17:0 cyclo and 19:0 cycloω8c.
Phosphatidylethanolamine was detected as the major polar lipid and phosphatidylglycerol and diphosphatidylglycerol as minor components.
The type strain is strain K24T (=DSM 13608T=NCIMB 13708T).
Strain K24T was isolated from soil after continuous enrichment with 1-(4'-carboxyphenylazo)-4-naphthol.
